resmush 0.0.0.9000

Optimize a local file

Source: R/resmush_file.R
resmush_file.Rd

Optimize a local images using the reSmush.it API.

Note that the default parameters of the function outfile = file overwrites the local file. See Examples.

Usage

resmush_file(file, outfile = file, qlty = 92, verbose = FALSE)

Arguments

file

Path to a local file. reSmush can optimize the following image files:

  • png

  • jpg

  • gif

  • bmp

  • tif

outfile

Path where the optimized file would be store in your disk. By default, it would override the file specified in file.

qlty

Only affects jpg files. Integer between 0 and 100 indicating the optimization level. For optimal results use vales above 90.

verbose

Logical. If TRUE displays a summary of the results.

Value

Writes on disk the optimized file if the API call is successful. In any case, a (invisibly) data frame with a summary of the process is returned as well.

See also

reSmush.it API docs.

Examples


# \donttest{
png_file <- system.file("extimg/example.png", package = "resmush")

# For example, writes to a temp file
tmp_png <- tempfile(fileext = ".png")

# Silently returns a data frame
png_res <- resmush_file(png_file, outfile = tmp_png)
png_res[, -c(1:2)]
#>   src_size dest_size compress_ratio notes
#> 1 239.9 Kb   70.7 Kb          29.5% OK ;)

# Use with jpg and parameters
jpg_file <- system.file("extimg/example.jpg", package = "resmush")

# For example, writes to a temp file
tmp_jpg <- tempfile(fileext = ".jpg")

# Silently returns a data frame
resmush_file(jpg_file, outfile = tmp_png, verbose = TRUE)
#> ✔ D:/a/_temp/Library/resmush/extimg/example.jpg optimized: 100.4 Kb => 83.2 Kb (82.8%)
#> ℹ Check output: C:\Users\RUNNER~1\AppData\Local\Temp\RtmpK8u2ma\file104c16b4684b.png
resmush_file(jpg_file, outfile = tmp_png, verbose = TRUE, qlty = 10)
#> ✔ D:/a/_temp/Library/resmush/extimg/example.jpg optimized: 100.4 Kb => 6.4 Kb (6.4%)
#> ℹ Check output: C:\Users\RUNNER~1\AppData\Local\Temp\RtmpK8u2ma\file104c16b4684b.png
# }
